title: New York State Legislators to Vote on Gun and Ballot Bills as Session Winds Down
sub_head: Lawmakers will likely move to pass legislation banning the sale of ghost guns and expediting the tallying of absentee ballots
body:
Several gun-control measures, judicial nominations and a bill letting sexual-abuse victims sue their attackers are on New York state lawmakers’ to-do lists as they wrap up their annual legislative session this week in Albany.
Advocates are pushing Democrats who dominate the state Assembly and Senate to take up a series of measures, some of which have already cleared one legislative house, before the lawmakers’ scheduled adjournment on Thursday.
Assembly Speaker Carl Heastie told Democratic members in a Thursday afternoon conference that the chamber planned to vote on bills that would jump-start the process of counting absentee ballots in elections and prohibit the sale of untraceable weapons assembled from kits, known as “ghost guns,” lawmakers said.
But several other measures remain up in the air, Assembly members said, including changes to parole laws designed to move people out of jail, and a bill that would extend the pandemic-related authorization of restaurants to sell alcohol to go.
